data.title: Current shows - sro audiences
data.text:
DAVE GORMAN MODERN LIFE IS GOODISH

Iconic hit comedy show Dave Gorman Modern Life is Goodish is back for four brand-new specials.

Dave Gorman Modern Life is Goodish ran for five series on Dave, attracting 1.5 million viewers per episode at its peak and was one of UKTVs longest running and successful original commissions. Armed with a computer, clicker and checked shirt, Dave casts an eye over modern life in his own unique style combining stand-up, visual storytelling, and real-world experimentation. In these mischievous comedy performances, Dave turns his attention to the areas of everyday life we normally take for granted, scrutinising the absurdities and contradictions that continue to fascinate and infuriate him.

The third & fourth episodes will be recorded with our live audience on Thursday 19th September 2024 at the Tabernacle in Notting Hill, London, W11 from 4.45pm until 9.30pm, with an intermission between.

Booking is now open so if you would like to join us by 4.45pm for an evening of top comedy, then apply now!

UNSPEAKABLE

Unspeakable! is the brand new BBC Radio 4 comedy show that invents brand new words never before uttered into existence, hosted by with Phil Wang & Susie Dent and featuring some top tier comedy guests.

Have you ever had an emotion or sensation, on the tip of your tongue but just couldnt find the word to describe it perfectly? Finally, here's the show for you.

Phil Wang and Susie Dent challenge their very special guests to dream up new words that describe universal, shared concepts and experiences which have always lacked names. UNTIL NOW!

The show will be recorded on Tuesday 27th August Monday 2nd & Wednesday 4th September 2024 at The Backyard Comedy Club, 231 Cambridge Heath Rd, London E2 0EL and booking is now open so if you'd like to join us for a celebration of language, a laugh at ourselves and a perfect cure for that relatable moment when we're completely lost for words, then apply now!

LOOSE WOMEN

Britains longest-running daytime talk show Loose Women is live every weekday on ITV1 at 12.30pm!

Every day, four of our 'Loose Women' give their take on the big stories of the day and share their innermost secrets. Come along and hear news and views from our family of Loose Women presenters, including Ruth Langsford, Christine Lampard, Stacey Solomon, Dame Kelly Holmes MBE, Katie Piper, Kaye Adams, Coleen Nolan, Brenda Edwards, Linda Robson, Janet Street-Porter, Denise Welch, Jane Moore, Gloria Hunniford, Frankie Bridge, Nadia Sawalha, Charlene White, Kelle Bryan, Sophie Morgan, Sunetra Sarker and Judi Love.

Famous for its irreverent content and sense of humour, each episode combines entertaining chat, poignant stories and reactions to the big news stories of the day and also features celebrity guests from the world of entertainment joining the Loose Women for a natter.

ITV's 'Loose Women' takes place at Television Centre, White City, West London on weekdays and booking is now open for dates up until the end of November 2024, so if you'd like to apply to join the ladies live for a lunchtime of fun chat, then apply now!

Hello everyone!

Tickets for all of the shows at SRO Audiences are free, but if you would like to make a contribution to a charity that is close to our hearts, then pop along to the Comic Relief website.

You can donate as little or as much as you can afford, and you can always go back and make another donation when you'd like to. All of the money that Comic Relief raises really makes a difference to the lives of people both here in the UK and around the world. If you're about to make a donation, then you're about to do something incredible. Thank you.

To make a donation, you should visit the Comic Relief donation page, which you can reach via this link: https://www.comicrelief.com/sroaudiences

On their page, you can also read about the work that Comic Relief are doing.

Comic Relief is a registered charity number 326568 (England & Wales) and SC039730 (Scotland).

OPEN HOUSE: THE GREAT SEX EXPERIMENT  NEW SERIES CASTING NOW

DONT BELIEVE IN MONOGAMY? CONSIDERING OPENING UP YOUR RELATIONSHIP?

Channel 4s bold series invites UK-based adventurous couples to come to a luxury retreat to test whether opening up their relationships and having sex with other people will strengthen their bond.

Were now looking for our next crop of curious couples to take part in this hit social experiment! Were in the last couple of weeks of casting so please dont delay.

Filming is due to take place in September 2024 at a location TBC. Each couple will be away from home for a filming period of 4-5 days. The minimum age for the show is 18 years old.

CONTESTANTS WANTED for 007: ROAD TO A MILLION on Prime Video

007: Road To A Million is a global adventure competition show where you have the chance to win up to one million pounds. The first series is now on Prime Video.

Were now searching for more dynamic duos to jet set across the globe using their wits and general knowledge to answer questions hidden around the world.

You dont have to be a Bond fan to apply but we are looking for teams of two that have close relationships and an amazing story to tell.

Filming is due to take place throughout 2024 and you will be away from home, possibly out of the UK-for short periods.

We're in the last few weeks of casting, so please don't delay!

WHEEL OF FORTUNE hosted by GRAHAM NORTON taping in Manchester

Legendary game show Wheel of Fortune is spinning its way back to ITV1 and ITVX, with host Graham Norton.

The epic game show once again be centres around a giant carnival wheel as the contestants spin to win for a life-changing cash prize. The turn of the wheel secures a cash value before they pick a letter to help them solve the puzzle. However, they could lose everything at a spin of a wheel which contains bankrupts and lose a turn and the contestants' entire winnings could be wiped out. They can also win some other pretty impressive prizes to add to their cash pot; everything is up for grabs but only one lucky contestant gets the chance to add big money to their cash pot and see if they can take it home.

The show was recorded at Dock 10 Studios, MediaCity, Manchester.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

HAVE I GOT NEWS FOR YOU

Based on the week's news, Have I Got News for You is fronted by guest hosts and features two regular team captains, Paul Merton and Ian Hislop.

Each week, the show invites two guests to cast a jaundiced eye over the week's news, resulting in a fast flow of anarchic, spontaneous and hugely entertaining wit and humour. Guests typically represent the world of politics, comedy, show-business and journalism, and are often themselves particularly newsworthy participants. The final touches of Have I Got News For You are put together only hours before recording, allowing guests to comment on the late-breaking news stories of the day.

The show records at Riverside Studios in Hammersmith, London.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

PAUL SINHA'S PERFECT PUB QUIZ for R4

Stand-up, quizzer and Rose dOr winner Paul Sinha returns to BBC Radio 4 with a third series of Paul Sinha's Perfect Pub Quiz.

Join Paul as he tests your trivia knowledge and recounts the fascinating and hilarious stories behind amazing facts. And youll also get a chance to ask your favourite question, to see if he really is as knowledgeable as he seems.

A show that, like a good pub quiz, is clever, noisy, and enjoyably shambolic - The Daily Mail

If you love armchair quizzing, chances are youll love this - The Times

Sinhas real talent, for batting everything the audience threw at him back with a sharp comic spin, is a rare one, to be celebrated - The Telegraph

Although booking has not yet opened for the next recording of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

THE GREAT BRITISH BAKE OFF - AN EXTRA SLICE

As a brand new Bake Off returns, so does An Extra Slice!

Host Jo Brand serves up more fun chat and gets stuck into the latest action from the tent alongside a panel of celebrity Bake Off fans. Comedian Tom Allen will be judging the bakes brought along by some Home Bakers, plus there will be unseen moments from the tent; pictures of the best & worst viewers bakes from home and Jo catches up live in studio with the latest baker to leave the tent.

An Extra Slice records at TV Centre, Wood Lane, London, W12 7FA!

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

THE BIG FAT QUIZ OF THE YEAR 2023

Who was the real star of the King's Coronation? Who went viral for wearing a puffer jacket? Were you team Barbie or Oppenheimer? All these questions and more will be answered in The Big Fat Quiz of the Year 2023

Question master Jimmy Carr is joined by celebrity teams as they battle it out to see who knows the most about the year that's been.

Helping Jimmy ask the big questions are Charles Dance, the children of Mitchell Brook Primary School and a whole host of celebrity question setters looking back at 2023.

In 2023, the show was recorded at Television Centre, White City, London.

Please also note that we expect this recording to finish at approximately 11.15pm. If you are unable to stay until this time, please do not apply for this show.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

CRYBABIES PRESENT.... BAGBEARD for Radio 4

Crybabies' unique blend of narrative-driven sketch comedy earned them a nomination for Best Newcomer at the Edinburgh Comedy Awards and a host of 5 star reviews.

Set on a strange forgotten island off the English coast, erstwhile science teacher Chris Mystery (not Christmas Tree) discovers an alien creature from a faraway universe...Bagbeard. Desperate to share his discovery and achieve the acclaim he's always desired, Mystery must conceal this alien creature from the baying townspeople and Terminator-esque government agent, Victor Valentine.

Bagbeard is E.T meets The Wicker Man meets Harry meets Sally. Join James Gault (tall), Ed Jones (handsome) and Michael Clarke (??), accompanied by Kevin Eldon (who will play Withers) and Nimisha Odedra (in a miscellany of roles), for this boundlessly absurd, sci-fi infected, narrative sketch adventure about finding your place in the universe.

The show recorded at The Backyard Comedy Club, 231 Cambridge Heath Road, Bethnal Green, London E2 0EL.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

LATE NIGHT LYCETT

Joe Lycett broadcasts live from his hometown of Birmingham.

Each episode features a mix of Joes community of local legends, LGBTQ+ heroes and allies joining him alongside celebrities and big-name guests from the worlds of comedy, television, music and film. With inclusivity and fun at its heart, the series sees Joe take a look back at the week in a way only he can  combining his unique brand of mischief and mayhem with his singular style of comedy. Shot on the banks of Birminghams canals, the show brings a touch of Hollywood sparkle to Digbeth in a big night of unmissable entertainment.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

JUNIOR TASKMASTER

Junior Taskmaster is the incredibly exciting offspring of the multi-award-winning Taskmaster.

The show keeps all the much-loved elements of Taskmaster, but now twenty-five children aged between 9-11 will be competing for the golden head of our brand-new Junior Taskmaster, Rose Matafeo. Rose is joined by her brand-new assistant, Mike Wozniak and the tasks take place in our brand-new Junior Taskmaster house.

The show was recorded at Television Centre, White City, London.

Please note that although people aged 9 and over are welcome, all persons aged between 9 & 18 must be accompanied by an adult over 18 years.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

ROMESH RANGANATHAN'S PARENTS EVENING

Romesh Ranganathan is hosting a brand new Saturday night game show where some of the nation's best-loved celebs will be teaming up with their daughters, sons, mums and dads to compete in an evening of entertainment like no other.

PARENTS EVENING is packed with big stars, huge laughs and enormous embarrassment - as the contestants fortunes lie in the hands of those supposed to know them best their parents. Yes, to win big on this show, adult contestants just have to meet their parents expectations (perhaps for the very first time). Likewise, Romesh will be doing his best to keep his own mum, Shanthi, happy as she helps oversee proceedings and keep Romesh in check.

Guests for the first series included Joel Dommett, Vicky Pattison, Richard Madeley, Mel B, Jonathan Ross, Alison Hammond & Carol Vorderman, each with a member of their family.

The show was recorded at BBC Elstree Studios in Borehamwood.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

BEST MEDICINE with KIRI PRITCHARD-McLEAN

Hosted by award-winning comedian Kiri Pritchard-McLean (The News Quiz, Would I Lie to You, Have I Got News For You, Live at The Apollo), Best Medicine is an uplifting, hilarious and fascinating panel discussion show for BBC Radio 4 that celebrates the of medicine's inspiring past, present and future. Its all about little-known facts and deep dives into the science, happy accidents and pioneering historical characters of medicine. Kiri will challenge a panel of medical experts and a load of famous comedians to each make a case for what they think is 'the best medicine', and each guest will champion an invention, a technique, a pill, potion or person. Whether it's world-changing science, an obscure invention or an unsung hero, it's always something worth celebrating.

Did you know there's a pill made out of cameras you can swallow to check for cancer? Or that you can 3D print artificial ovaries, blood vessels, even pancreases? Or that the first ever tooth transplant was on the head of a cockerel?

The show was recorded at Up the Creek in Greenwich.

Each audience will see two episodes. It's a night of knowledge and laughter featuring life-saving surgeons, groundbreaking scientists, ingenious cancer-cures and some of the best comedians in the business.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

8 OUT OF 10 CATS DOES COUNTDOWN - Taping in Manchester

Two of Channel 4's most popular programmes come together for 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown.

8 Out of 10 Cats host Jimmy Carr and some special guest team captains - will play their very own version of TV's classic quiz, Countdown, along with celebrity guests from the world of comedy and entertainment. As ever, Countdown's Rachel Riley is at the letters and numbers board and Dictionary Corner regular Susie Dent is ably assisted by a top comedian. There's the classic Countdown letters and numbers games; all mixed up with a good dollop of 8 Out of 10 Cats banter. The stars of 8 Out of 10 Cats bring their own irreverent style to the nation's favourite daytime quiz show.

The show records at MediaCity, Manchester.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

THE CHASE

It's The Chase, presented by the inimitable Bradley Walsh, in which four contestants take on one of the country's finest quiz brains in order to win! But who will they be facing?

Will they have to grapple with The Governess, Anne Hegerty? Could they be in a showdown against The Sinnerman, Paul Sinha? Perhaps they can out fox The Vixen, Jenny Ryan? Are they good enough to decimate The Dark Destroyer, Shaun Wallace or maybe even bring down the biggest of them all, The Beast, Mark Labbett. They think they're clever enough so, The Chase is on!

The show records at BBC Elstree Studios in Borehamwood.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

RUM PUNCH

Rum Punch is a new sitcom created by and starring one of the most exciting up and coming comedians in the country, Travis Jay.

Fast paced, warm and hilarious, Rum Punch follows a multigenerational family as they juggle pursuit of their individual ambitions with their responsibilities to the family business - a Caribbean restaurant in the heart of Lewisham.

Travis Jay's last stand up show, Son of David, enjoyed a run at Soho Theatre and a sold out performance at Londons Bloomsbury Theatre. He has supported comedy legend Dave Chapelle and Britain's Got Talent winner Kojo Amin across the UK. On screen, he has appeared on shows for BBC, ITV, Channel 4, UKTV, Comedy Central and Netflix.

Rum Punch will be produced by Avalon, the multi-award-winning talent management, television production and live promotion group behind hit shows such as Not Going Out, Breeders and Taskmaster.

The show was recorded at Theatre Peckham.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

BEAT THE CHASERS

Bradley Walsh presents Beat The Chasers.

All six of The Chasers, the superheroes of general knowledge, are teaming up again and taking on anyone who thinks they can beat them. With Beat The Chasers, theres no hiding in a team; the contestants must take on the giants of quiz alone! And if they win, theres a huge cash prize awaiting them.

The Greatest Quiz Team in the world (The Beast, The Dark Destroyer, The Governess, The Sinnerman, The Menace & The Vixen) are together again on ITVs prime time quiz.

The show records at Elstree Film & TV Studios.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

IVO GRAHAM'S OBSESSIONS

Standup comedian Ivo Graham brings back a beloved Radio 4 format for a new audience. Obsessions sees a panel of celebrities sharing their secret obsessions with the listener, and have them celebrated, challenged and dissected by the host.

Obsessions brings together a panel of unlikely bedfellows with even more unlikely interests, and we find out what hidden passions, knowledge or collections some well-known people hold close to their hearts.

Each week alongside the panel, Ivo seeks out the VOP (Very Obsessed Person) of the week, to celebrate their truly extraordinary passions. Ivo also quizzes the audience to find out what the Great British public are obsessed with at the moment.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

DON'T HATE THE PLAYAZ

Dont Hate The Playaz is back! Join us at the anarchic music-entertainment show that celebrates all things rap and hip-hop, and features some of the most exciting names on the UK music scene.

Hosted by Jordan Stephens, two teams of celebrity, music and comedy guests are led by team captains Maya Jama and Lady Leshurr, all backed up by DJ Shortee Blitz on the decks. The show will have performance rounds, physical challenges and above all loads of great live music! The winners are decided on the night by the studio audience, who will play a huge part in the show.

The show recorded at Elstree Film & TV Studios, Borehamwood.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

MEL GIEDROYC: UNFORGIVABLE

Mel Giedroyc: Unforgivable is the comedy panel show where it pays to prove youre a terrible human being. Each week, three celebrity guests compete to over-share their most dastardly behaviour.

The aim of the game is simple: over a series of rounds, who can prove they are the worst sinner and ultimately the most Unforgivable. Each round encourages our guests to one-up each other as well as testing their true sinning nature. At the end of the show, Mel - with the help of her assistant Lou Sanders - will decide which of the three has most outdone themselves in their wrongdoings and is designated truly Unforgivable.

Amongst those joining Mel & Louhave been Craig Revel Horwood, Dermot OLeary, Stephen Mangan, Jonathan Ross, Kerry Godliman, Guz Khan & Charlotte Church.

The show records at Riverside Studios, Hammersmith.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

THE REAL FULL MONTY 2023

Come and join Ashley Banjo for a star-studded evening as brave male and female celebrities take to the stage as they dare to bare all to raise awareness for male & female cancers.

Our courageous cast rehearsing relentlessly for months working towards two show-stopping dance routines choreographed by the one and only Ashley Banjo. They put their nerves aside as they hope to build on the impact of the previous years key health messages and promote regular checks for testicular and prostate cancer and for women to keep checking their boobs and attending smear tests.

The 2023 show was recorded at The New Wimbledon Theatre in Wimbledon.

Please note: this is an over 18s audience ONLY. This performance will contain nudity.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

THE MARTIN LEWIS MONEY SHOW LIVE

The Martin Lewis Money Show Live needs you!

The series sees Martin answer the financial questions that matter most to you, as well as his latest tips on how to make the most of your money and the return of the Big Briefing.

Don't miss your chance to be part of the live audience - and you could even have your question answered by the most trusted man in Britain.

The most recent episode of the show took place at Television Centre, White City, London.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

GAME ON GRANDPARENTS

Attention gaming enthusiasts and families!

Gear up for an exhilarating and laughter-packed experience as CBBC's Game On Grandparents makes a comeback!

Calling all grandparents, parents and kids 7 years and over! Round up your loved ones and join us for an unforgettable esports extravaganza that promises to redefine family entertainment. We invite you to be a part of the ultimate fusion of gaming, family fun and a touch of YouTube magic!

Get ready for special guests who are no strangers to the Gaming World - the incredible trio of Yammy, Slogo and Jelly, along with Game on Grandparents anchor Jules! These YouTube sensations will bring their unique flair to the show, delivering laughter, energy and a whole lot of gaming expertise. Its a star-studded affair you won't want to miss, as our live audience witness the magic unfold on CBBC - because when it comes to family entertainment, Game On Grandparents is the name of the game. Please note that, as this show is for CBBC, each party must contain at least one child and parties not containing a child will not be admitted.

The show was recorded at Versa Studios, Manchester.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

THE ULTIMATE CHOICE with STEPH McGOVERN taping in MANCHESTER

The Ultimate Choice is a hilarious and ingenious comedy show for BBC Radio 4, hosted by the brilliant Steph McGovern.

Two top comedians must pit their wits against a parade of fiendish, mischievous and downright daft dilemmas, like they've never faced before. With help from guest experts - and even you, dear audience - theyll have to make the biggest choices of their lives for your entertainment and delight.

Expect cracking guests, belly-laughs galore, and a sprinkling of fun facts too - all presided over with Stephs inimitable charm. For fans of Would I Lie To You, Room 101 or anyone whos ever played would you rather?'.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

IAN SMITH IS STRESSED

Join Edinburgh Comedy Award-nominee Ian Smith as he records his debut Radio 4 stand-up series, Ian Smith Is Stressed.

With topics ranging from The North, the body, love and holidays, Ian has been to a farm to hug a cow, attended a topless body painting party, took a dip in an ice bath with his girlfriend and even tried to land a passenger plane with no training. Now, Ian brings his critically acclaimed stressed-out stand up to this special recording.

Ian is a regular on Radio 4, having appeared on The News Quiz, The Now Show, and Just A Minute.

Ian Smith turns incredulity into an art form, confirming his status as the undisputed sultan of nerve-shredding stress Rolling Stone.

There are few shows as purely funny as this Guardian.

The show was recorded at Up the Creek in Greenwich.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

NATURE TABLE with SUE PERKINS taping at Kew Gardens

Roll up! Roll up! Join comedian, writer and passionate nature supporter Sue Perkins, as she hosts a new series of Radio 4's popular wildlife comedy extravaganza Nature Table.

On the show, Sues joined by top celebrity guests from the worlds of comedy and natural history. Celebrating the natural worlds funny eccentricities, each guest shows and tells an item linked to the wild world to share with the audience, as a springboard for a funny illuminating discussion. Nature Table has a simple clear brief: to celebrate and promote the magnificence of all our planets wonderfully wild flora and fauna and to have a good giggle.

Our last series won Silver for Best Comedy at the ARIA awards 2023, so please dont miss this fab opportunity to witness Sue and the gang record this warm, positive and delightfully funny comedy.

Episodes of the show have recorded at London Zoo & Kew Gardens.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

DO GOODERS

Do Gooders is a fresh ensemble workplace sitcom for BBC Radio 4 that takes us behind the curtain of the charity industry and mines the numerous frustrations that come with trying to do good on an industrial scale. The show follows the fundraising events team of a [fictional] midlevel charity, Alzheimers Alliance.

AA are constantly aware that theyre never more than one 'ice bucket challenge away from slipping right down the league tables. Compounding external pressures is a fiercely competitive battle between the teams responsible for the two types of events fundraising, Challenge Events (Bike Rides, Marathons) and Virtual Events (Online).

The show is written and created by comedian Garrett Millerick, who has featured on every Best Reviewed Shows of The Edinburgh Festival list since 2018. Do Gooders will be produced by Avalon, the multi-award-winning talent management, television production and live promotion group behind hit shows such as Not Going Out, Breeders and Taskmaster.

The cast includes Frank Skinner, Garrett Millerick, Ahir Shah and Ania Magliano.

The show was recorded at Theatre Peckham, London SE5.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

THE MANY WRONGS OF LORD CHRISTIAN BRIGHTY

A new Radio 4 sitcom about a hedonistic Regency-era aristocrat who has an epiphany and decides he must right all his many past misdeeds, accompanied by his radical chambermaid Babs and very reluctant butler Churlington. Think 'Bridgerton' and 'Poldark' mashed up with My Name Is Earl.

Lord Christian Brighty is the talk of the Regency Ton - a celebrated libertine, a heartthrob and a hero to many. But close-up, he is a spoilt, impetuous, life-ruining bastard or at least he was. Because his previously carefree life of casual debauchery, non-stop revelry and infinite privilege has been upended by an unfortunate accident (shot by a cannon after a new servants hazing ritual goes awry) and an even more unfortunate period of recovery, where his intended victim - uneducated but forthright chambermaid Babbigail (Babs for short) - decides straight-talking is the best medicine and thus becomes the first person ever to tell him the unvarnished truth about himself and the consequences of his actions.

So now, with his narcissism collapsing and faith in the system shattered, Lord Brighty is determined to fix all his past wrongs - and by extension all the ills of Regency society. Accompanying him in his quest are Babs (elevated beyond her station to a chambermaid-cum-adviser role) and dutiful butler Churlington  who would really just like everything to stay exactly as it used to be (as would all Brightys friends, family and the entirety of high society).

Written by award-winning comedians Christian Brighty and Amy Greaves, whose sketches based on Bridgerton, Poldark and Jane Austen (@brightybuoy) have catapulted them to viral stardom, with over 100 million views across TikTok and Instagram - securing Christians place as the internets answer to Mr Darcy, and earning them a nomination for a Writers Guild Award.

The show was recorded in Hoxton Hall, London N1 6SH.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

THE CHRIS & ROSIE RAMSEY SHOW

Following on from the huge success of their award-winning podcast Sh**ged. Married. Annoyed (Over 145 million downloads) and the first series of their late night comedy chat show, real life husband and wife, Chris & Rosie Ramsey, are back for series two!

The side-splittingly honest pair will be joined by another celebrity couple to poke fun at life; growing up, relationships, arguments, annoyances, parenting and everything in between.

And of course theyll be asking... Whats Your Beef?

We are particularly looking for couples to be part of our studio audience (friends, family members or those in a relationship) who are willing to air their beef with each other. What petty, menial, or gross things do you each do that utterly annoy each other? This is the chance for both of you to air your beef - with Chris & Rosie's help! Please note that both participants must be willing and happy to appear on the show and couples selected to share their beef will be given priority tickets to attend.

The show records at Television Centre, White City, London.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

WOULD I LIE TO YOU?

Would I Lie To You is the hilarious BBC1 comedy panel show with host Rob Brydon (Gavin & Stacey) and returning popular Team Captains David Mitchell (Peep Show) and Lee Mack (Not Going Out)!

The celebrity guests remain poker-faced while revealing personal stories, being put through their paces in a quick-fire lies round, and explaining their real or invented relationship with a mystery studio guest - all with the ultimate aim of filtering the truth from the fiction. The show is all about stories, cross-examination and the ability both to talk nonsense and to pick holes in someone else's argument.

The show was recorded at Pinewood Studios.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

CHLOE PETTS' TOILET HUMOUR for R4

Chloe Petts (The Stand-Up Sketch Show, Richard Osmans House of Games, Hypothetical) presents a new five-part stand-up series for BBC Radio 4. Chloe Petts Toilet Humour explores the history of the loo and how we relate to one another within them. Starting in the latrines of Ancient Rome passing through to whatever George Michael was getting up to in the 1990s, Chloe Petts looks backwards to try and make sense of how we've got to where we are now; a culture war being fought in a place where she once did a sh*t so big they had to retire the toilet.

In 2023, Petts performed her debut show Transience to sold-out audiences at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival and for two 5-night runs at Soho Theatre. She is an alumna of the prestigious Pleasance Comedy Reserve, shortlisted for the BBC Comedy Award, finalist of Leicester Square New Comedian of the Year Awards 2017 and runner-up in the Funny Women Awards 2017. As well as supporting Ed Gamble on his Electric UK tour and Frank Skinner during his West End run. Chloe performed at Melbourne International Comedy Festival last year and is returning with her new show for this upcoming years festival.

Chloe Petts Toilet Humour will be produced by Avalon, the multi-award-winning talent management, television production and live promotion group behind hit shows such as Taskmaster, The Russell Howard Hour, Breeders and Starstruck.

The show was recorded at Up the Creek Comedy Club, Greenwich, London.

Although we have no details of further recordings of this show, if you would like to add your details to our mailing list here, we can email you with details of possible future recordings.

ALL STAR MUSICALS

All Star Musicals returned for two very special nights.

John Barrowman hosted alongside a panel of critics compiled of some of the West End and Broadway's most distinguished talent.

Six celebrities flexed their theatrical muscles each night, as they embarked on the ultimate musical theatre masterclass, mentored by a panel of experts compiled from some of the West End and Broadway's most distinguished talent.

Each show saw a crop of famous faces take to the stage to perform iconic musical numbers. Our famous faces, all of whom were selected based on their stand out performance skills, aimed to impress our audience. The numbers featured were from a range of famous musicals, both contemporary and traditional, with the live audience getting to vote at the end of the night whose performance wowed them the most.

The show took place at The Troubadour, Wembley Park, London.

DRAW FIRE with MAISIE ADAM

Will our comedians be funny enough to convert the great British public to their twisted way of thinking? Or will they fail miserably? Our moneys on the latter.

The show was recorded at The Pleasance Theatre, Islington North London and, when they arrive, our audience needed to download a voting app onto their phones for the purposes of the record (and which could be deleted immediately after).

COMEDY AGAINST LIVING MISERABLY

Jo Brand hosts Comedy Against Living Miserably, the third in a series of stand-up specials in partnership with CALM (Campaign Against Living Miserably). Joining Jo will be Tom Allen, Russell Kane, and Marlon Davis.

The show will be filmed in front of our live audience at EartH (Theatre) in Hackney, East London on Sunday 29th March.

Comedy Against Living Miserably is the latest initiative in Daves partnership with CALM since the Be the Mate Youd Want campaign launched in 2018.

The series aims to get the comedy community to join in and help foster a more positive and open culture when it comes to mental health.

The specials will star some of the nations biggest names in comedy and will air on Dave this year. The comics will be waiving their fee to donate to the charity, which will also be matched by UKTV. There will be the opportunity for audience to donate to CALM on the night.

ROB NEWMAN ON AIR

One of Britains finest comedians, Rob Newman brings a brand new run of his multi-award-winning BBC comedy series to the air.

Filled with his trademark mix of stand-up and sketches, Rob tries to manage his chaotic life while getting his head around millions of years of Earths history, from the Cambrian Explosion to Zoom psychotherapy, from Julius Caesars traffic-calming measures to why Bono might be eaten by wild animals. Newman On Air tells a different story about who we are, how we got here, and where we might yet go. Its unlike any other comedy show youll see this year.

"Intellectually charged and adorably ambitious. A delightfully digestible dose of brain food." The Times. "Refreshingly intelligent and hugely entertaining." (The Guardian).

The show records at Up the Creek in Greenwich.

EXPLICABLE ME

Hosted by Suzi Ruffell, assisted by Ahir Shah, Explicable Me is a comedy entertainment show built around personality tests. We all love those Buzzfeed and Cosmopolitan tests that discover what pizza topping we are, what percentage Kardashian we are and if our sex life were a movie what movie would it be.

Suzi welcomes two celebrity guests to the show, and Ahir administers our own bespoke, funny, slightly unusual personality tests to find out what drives them, what other people think of them, and what direction their moral compass is pointing. On Tuesday 21st January, Suzi's guests will be AJ Odudu & Tom Allen.

This BBC Radio 2 show will play host to some great stars, make you laugh and perhaps even make you reassess just who you are as a human.

IMRAN YUSUF: RELABELLED - ONLINE

Comedian Imran Yusuf 's debut show for BBC Radio 4; Imran Yusuf: Relabelled was an online recording.

Nominated for an Edinburgh Comedy Award, Imran is a cheeky, charming and insightful comedian whose astute observations and honesty will have you howling and agreeing very much.

In his first show for Radio 4, he looks at what it means to be a 'man'. Where does masculinity come from? What does masculinity amount to in the modern world? Where did Imran find his inspirational role models? Was it in Jackie Chan, in women out of his league or in a man called 'Sensei Eric'?

Our audience were online, enjoying Imran's show from the comfort of their own sofa, alone or with their household.

LOBBY LAND

Lobby Land is Radio 4s new, topical audience sitcom following the life of young political editor Samantha Peakes as she tries to stay afloat in the weird world of Westminster and find stories for her clickbait website Hot Takes.

Will anyone solve Brexit? Will our political parties all implode? Will Sam keep her job?

Amidst the chaos that is modern Britain, Lobby Land is a new satirical riposte starring Cariad Lloyd, Dan Tetsell & Charlie Higson. Recorded the day before transmission for extra bite, its set to be the sharpest sitcom on the airwaves this summer.

The show was recorded at The Shaw Theatre, London NW1 near Kings Cross & Euston stations.

THE TEZ O'CLOCK SHOW

One of the most exciting break out stars in British comedy, Tez Ilyas, has his own show, The Tez OClock Show, a late-night satirical comedy show that is TRULY anti-establishment  its hosted by a northern working-class British-Asian-Muslim.

Comedian Tez Ilyas presents a fast-paced mix of stand-up, sketches and studio antics. Filmed in Manchester with a combination of comedians and celebrity guests, this hilarious and subversive show will blow the cobwebs off TV satire and prove once and for all that its possible to joke about anyone and anything without getting cancelled.

The show is a topical mix of sketches and studio antics, including provocative monologues and celebrity interviews.

Crashing into the studio show will be parodies, sketches and news bulletins from the Pakistani Broadcasting Corporation (PBC), starring Man Like Mobeens Guz Khan and comedian Sindhu Vee, which will provide a satirical take on the news and show Britain (and the West) in a very different light.

The studio show sees Tez take part in a briefing room  just like the ones that happened when he worked at the Home Office - on the hot topics of the day. Here hell be briefed by his fellow fast rising comics and Uncivil Servants, Sophie Willan and Adam Rowe, who will each try and sway him to their way of thinking.

Hell then be joined by his co-anchor Sindhu Vee, in the on set shisha café, where theyll be joined by funny, opinionated, big name guests.

Therell even be a chance for some of our audience to weigh in on hot topics  so if you like shouting at the telly, then this could be your moment.

The series was filmed at Dock 10, Media City, Salford.
